newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BT/Dutch rail firm withdraw joint venmture notification.
newsitem.headline: BT/Dutch rail firm withdraw joint venmture notification.

text.p: European Commission sources said on Tuesday that the notification of a joint venture between British Telecommunications Plc (BT) and a Dutch state-owned rail firm had been withdrawn.
The sources gave no details, but a BT spokesman in Brussels told Reuters that the move was "purely technical" and that a fresh notification would be filed by the end of the November.

The Commission had started a probe into the deal between BT and Nederlandse Spoorwegen NV's subsidiary NS Groep NV after the companies submitted the deal for clearance on September 17 under the merger regulation 4064/89.
The venture called Telfort was created to bid for one of the two licences the Dutch government has decided to grant to build and operate national fixed-line public telephone networks.
The Dutch government must decide on the winners by January 9, 1997.

Global One -- an alliance between France Telecom, Deutsche Telekom and Sprint Corp of the United States -- and a consortium of Dutch energy firms called Enertel have also put in bids for the licences.
